FOUND IN: Turret (another architectural term for a small tower, especially one on top of a larger building like a castle)
Indebtedness (the state of being owed something)
Canter (a three-beat gait between walk and gallop which can be considered easier than a full gallop)
Scurrying scoundrel (describes someone acting in a cowardly way, perhaps evading confrontation like a 'mongrel')
Lolita - from Vladimir Nabokov's novel 'Lolita.' The protagonist, Humbert Humbert becomes obsessed with Dolores Haze, whom he nicknames Lolita.
Nessie (referring to the Loch Ness Monster)
Goslings (plural of gosling; though listed once already, it is a strong fit as well)
Carob - A sweet and naturally caffeine-free product made from the pod of the carob tree
